title: 103_hr2662
content:
The "Business Improvement Act of 1993" establishes business activity targets for small businesses and procurement procedures. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must consider contracts awarded to program participants before the enactment of the Act as contracts awarded for attainment of business activity targets. The Small Business Act is amended to allow participating agencies to enter into contracts with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals using restricted competition or a price preference. The authority granted will be in effect until September 30, 2000. Eligibility of past development program participants for Section 8(a) contract awards is also addressed. The Small Business Act is amended to allow agencies to contract with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals using restricted competition or a price preference until September 30, 2000. Eligibility for Section 8(a) contract awards for past development program participants is also addressed. SEC. 5 amends Section 8(a)(1) of the Small Business Act by eliminating competitive contracts under subparagraph (D). SEC. 6 ensures continued access to business opportunities. Section 8(a)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to require competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency if certain conditions are met. The Small Business Act is amended to require competition for contracts with participating agencies under certain conditions. The contractor must have graduated from a small business development program, and the competition may be restricted to small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals upon request. Eligible small businesses must agree to subcontract a percentage of the contract value to other small businesses. The Small Business Act requires competition for contracts with participating agencies under certain conditions. Small businesses must agree to subcontract a percentage of the contract value to other small businesses in the developmental stage of the minority small business and capital ownership development program. The head of the agency must ensure follow-on contracts are awarded under the same authority. SEC. 7. Study of development program participation terms by industry sector; suspension of development program graduations. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a study on program participation terms by industry sector for small businesses. Additionally, the suspension of development program graduations is extended for small businesses participating in certain programs or activities. Small business concerns participating in programs or activities under this paragraph or eligible for contracts under section 8(a) on October 1, 1992, can continue participation and eligibility until 365 days after final regulations are issued based on a study, or until their eligibility would otherwise expire. SEC. 8. COMPLIANCE WITH BUY INDIAN ACT.

Federal agencies contracting with the Small Business Administration under section 8(a) for goods or services from economically disadvantaged Indian tribes are considered compliant with the Buy Indian Act.

SEC. 9. UNIFORM PROCEDURES FOR CONTESTING STATUS OF CONCERNS.

The Administrator will establish uniform procedures for contesting the status of small business concerns owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals within 120 days.
